title: Guide
content:
I was planning on making a guide to well... everything. (In no particular order mind, updates would be random, but about once a day, everything will be organized and such, mush like the patch index.) and I was wondering, should I bother? Is there any demand for it?

It would (Eventually) cover gameplay, modding, modding tools, hints and tips, cheats and whatever else I can think of.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Guide
content:
Something like that would be great on the KeenWiki - I don't think there are any tutorials like that there at present. You could create one article for each type of modding, e.g. "Introduction to Level Editing", "Changing the Commander Keen sprite", "How to modify cheat codes", etc.

That would give us a reason to create a section on the wiki for tutorials.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Guide
content:
That reminds me I must write the GIMP tutorial for Modkeen bitmaps editing.------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Wiki it
content: Just contribute the info to the Wiki--we've got no shortage of information and compilations (like the Patch Index you so diligently maintain)... but having it all cross-linked, connected, and as fluid as possible is what makes it useful.  The Wiki seems to be a good place to conglomerate information--go for it!

title: Re: Wiki it
content:
There is definitely a demand. We just don't realize it yet.

Seriously, nothing's better than a comprehensive guide.--------------------
[url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/]Cerebral Cortex 314[/url] - For All of your Commander Keen Needs.
[url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/dave/joes.html]Eat at Joes[/url]

title: Re: Wiki it
content:
Hmmn, it'll be more difficult to do on the wiki, I'd need to be organized for one, but I think I can manage it, as soon as I finnish my program.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Wiki it
content: Wouldn't it be easier on the wiki?  In a forum you'd have to post the guide in order, on the wiki you can go back and rearrange things, move sections to different articles, etc.<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: Wiki it
content:
Not to mention that others can help out, add stuff, fix errors, etc... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] -Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Wiki it
content:
I wasn't going to post on the forum; I was just going to add stuff next to the patch index, bit by bit, *then* maybe upload to the wiki; I'm not a wiki person.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!
